alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, northeastern Prince George, northwestern York, James City, and north central Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 1245 AM EDT... At 1152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rustic, or over Claremont, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jamestown around 1205 AM EDT. Toano, College Of William And Mary and Kings Point around 1210 AM EDT. Williamsburg, Norge and York Terrace around 1215 AM EDT. Queens Lake around 1220 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include York River State Park, Croaker, Barlows Corner, Water Country U.S.A., Camp Peary, Spring Grove, Brandon, Centerville, Ewell and Christensons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.
